headline: Global Flashpoints Ignite: Uganda Election Mayhem, Greenland Standoff, Iran Protests Surge
summary: Uganda's presidential election spirals into violence as incumbent Yoweri Museveni leads amid opposition rigging claims and reports of Bobi Wine's abduction. NATO forces bolster defenses in Greenland against US threats under Trump, while Iran's protest death toll exceeds 3,000 amid crackdowns. Canada advances EV trade with China, signaling alliance shifts, as Trump's Gaza 'Board of Peace' aims to reshape reconstruction.
confirmed_facts: Uganda's Museveni heads for reelection per unofficial results
NATO including Denmark, France deploys F-35s and assets to Greenland for Exercise Arctic Sentry
Rights groups report over 3,000 deaths in Iran protests
Canada allows 49,000 Chinese EV imports amid US warnings
Trump announces Gaza 'Board of Peace' for stabilization
unconfirmed_claims: Ugandan opposition leader Bobi Wine abducted by military
US considering lump-sum payments to relocate Greenland residents
recent_changes: Uganda military denies Bobi Wine abduction amid internet blackouts (Jan 17)
FAA warns of elevated military activity over parts of Mexico, Colombia, Ecuador (Jan 17)
X and Grok suffer global outage (Jan 17)
watch_next: Uganda election final results and potential unrest
Iran protest escalation and regime response
